alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 8:20AM EDT until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Big Blue River at Carthage. Mill Creek near Cataract. Buck Creek at Acton. Sugar Creek at New Palestine. .2 To 4 inches of rainfall in the past few days has pushed several local creeks and streams above flood, along with large portions of the main stem rivers. Small streams will be in flood for the next 12 to 24 hours in many locations, with main stem rivers in flood for the next week or more in several locations. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar Creek at New Palestine. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Extensive flooding along Sugar Creek in southern Hancock and western Shelby Counties. After reaching this level, and when the Big Blue River was near 16.5 feet, one day later several homes along the creek west of Shelbyville were evacuated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to a crest of 8.7 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 10 PM EDT this evening.
